Australia:
The first Test match is played between Australia and England at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
The first direct Inter-colonial passenger trains began running between Adelaide and Melbourne.
Gold was discovered at Southern Cross, Western Australia.
Cambodia: Cambodia was subsumed into the Indochinese Union.
China: The Yellow River flood kills up to 2 million people and makes an additional 2 million homeless. At the time, it was the deadliest natural disaster ever recorded.
Colombia:
Eliseo Payán is the 2nd president of Colombia
Rafael Nuñez is the 3rd President of Colombia
France:
Work begins on the foundations of the Eiffel Tower.
Marie François Sadi Carnot began his term as president of France.
Germany: Germany and Russia signed the secret Reinsurance Treaty, in which each promised benevolent neutrality in the event the other should go to war.
Latvia: Russification measures began in the Baltic governorates of the Russian Empire.
Malta: Constitution of 1887 provides that four members in the Council of members were to represent the clergy, the nobility and landed proprietors, university graduates and the merchants.
Philippine: Rizal starts writing the El Filibusterismo
The Manila School of Agriculture is established.
Singapore:
Methodist Girls' School was established at Short Street.
Sir Cecil Clementi Smith was appointed as the Governor of the Straits Settlements.
The Raffles Hotel was established.
Taiwan:
Taiwan is reorganized as Taiwan Province with Liu Mingchuan as its first governor
Construction on a road from Taipei to Keelung begins
